title: theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: ‘I am mentally stuck’: My daughter has a financially reckless spouse. How do I protect her?
items.description: “I am afraid they will end up destitute and homeless.”

items.title: I’m 70 and have Alzheimer’s. My son’s girlfriend put $750 worth of lottery tickets on a credit card I gave him. What can I do?
items.description: “I contacted the credit-card company, but was advised they could not reimburse me for the theft.”

items.title: Is Marvell’s stock cheap? This $1 billion move shows the company seems to think so.
items.description: Marvell is doing an accelerated share repurchase that the CEO says signals “conviction in the business and the intrinsic value of our stock.”

items.title: New-home sales spike to 3-year high as builders pile on discounts to sell homes
items.description: Sales of new homes posted an unexpected jump in August as builders ramped up discounts and slashed prices to lure buyers.

items.title: My husband and I put our $1.2 million house in an irrevocable trust. Can we sell the home and buy another one?
items.description: “Do we have to buy a house for equal value or can we buy a less expensive house?”
